alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nicholas, southwestern Braxton, west central Webster and central Clay Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Otter, or 9 miles northeast of Clay, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clay, Birch River, Big Otter, Wallback, Harrison, Widen, Nebo, Frametown, Strange Creek, Servia, Muddlety, Boggs and Ivydale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 35 and 54. Route 19 between mile markers 47 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, north central and northeastern West Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and north central West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster
